DOC.brief_title: Outdoor Walking Strength Training After Acute Stroke Transient Ischemic Attack .
DOC.detailed_description: Eighty community-living individual Uppsala municipality include randomize control trial two arm . Intervention : Participants perform outdoor walk exercise program together one strength exercise 12 week . The intensity frequency train progressively increase . Participants suppose walk perform strength train 5-7 days/week . Methods : Clinical assessment , questionnaire medical record use documentation age , sex , comorbidity , blood pressure , medication previous education . Assessment motor function , cognition , level physical activity , food intake perceive stress perform screen baseline measurement . Walking capacity ( primary outcome measure ) , mobility , handgrip strength , body composition cardiovascular risk marker assess baseline 12 week training . At one year training health-related quality life , another cardiovascular incidence mortality evaluate . Power analysis perform . The investigator analyze data use intention-to -treat analysis . Participants participate least 50 % training session
DOC.criteria: 1 . Verified ischemic cerebral infarction intracerebral hemorrhage . 2 . Sufficient walk capacity motor function 3 . Able communicate Swedish 4 . Signed consent One following : 1 . Subarachnoid bleed 2 . Insufficient cognition impair ability understand instruction 3 . Medical problem make unsuitable participate 4 . Pacemaker ( body composition measurement )
